posts.content:
This Blade-virtuoso moves his weapons with deadly accuracy. His senses are heightened to epic proportions, and he spots cunning enemies hiding, ready for an ambush. He can also discover and disarm their most elaborate traps. He dabbles in magic and knows how to read any scroll.

Pros:
Outstanding AB +51, or +49 dual wielding mundane Kukris.
Critical hits galore: Stellar AB and Critical threat range: 13-20, or 10-20 with keen Kukris
EWS, high Strength and WM crit multiplier for massive damage
High spot skill
Detects and disarms standard epic traps
UMD
Evasion
Cons:
Average fortitude and reflex saves

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Nice piece of work you have here Mick and i like the high spot too.

How about you make him into an EDR III Dual-wielder? The last two WM feats can then be used for two of the EDR feats and i guess the AB will still be very good. By my calculations he can end at a Dual-wielding 45 AB and STR 24/ CON 22 with EDR 3, as a human still. Just throwing some ideas to the table here.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
He, he thank you Val', I really enjoy playing this character. He's a real grinder. And If I feel he needs more AC he can both grab a shield and activate Expertise. I always stack up with clarity potions to handle his low will save, and then everything is OK. Vs mages he wears down premonition/stoneskins in a round or two, and as long as he has some kind of enchantment on his Kukris that gives a minimum of elemental or other damage, he can land his Knockdowns and keep the mages stalled until they are dead meat. I have even worn down Epic warding that way, but that took a couple more rounds.
EDR feats are possible. The Forest Outlaw Staff Master - Fighter 12/Rogue 3/WM 25 by EROMB does just that. It is not geared towards dual wielding with a dexterity of 14. But it ends with a constitution of 22, so maybe there is room for a tweak if you start with Strength 15, Dexterity 15 and Constitution 15. You have to remove PA, Cleave, Great cleave, Disarm and Improved disarm to have WP exotic, all three dual wield feats and Blind fight. Of course you also have to change weapon focus to Kukri.

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content: My suggestion for replacing the knockdown feat with weapon focus dire mace, and then replace the two epic toughness feats with weapon of choice and epic weapon focus in dire mace. Always nice to have a bludgeoning weapon ready for the unforeseen.

posts.content: I like WhiZard's idea, but I suggest heavy flail instead for more damage.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Not a bad idea with a blunt weapon if you can live without KD. You will not get a second EWS though.

posts.content: Mick, i remembered this fella here cause i am building something with Hin's in mind, and just came to me the idea to make him a Halfling. Since kukris are tiny weapons and thus eligible for dual-wield even for small races you could go with Halfling too. Start with: (Str 15 Dex 15 Con 14 Int 14 Wis 08 Cha 08) and take the extra Great Str feat iin place of Esf: Spot, you will lose also the spot skill since you won't have that many skill points as a Human does but you will gain +1 AB/ +1 AC/ +1 To all Saves. Not that you desperately need another point of AB in this build exactly, but it's something that cross my mind and i just wanted to point it out. Anyway he is a great blender no matter how do you look at him!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Cute with halfling here for even better AB and AC.
I'd miss the high Spot skill, but a scroll of True seeing ca be an alternative in mods where it has not been altered.
With halfling you also have to remove a pre-epic feat. It is either Blind fight or Knockdown, and you also have to change the order in which you take some of the other pre epic feats..

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Concavenator wrote:
Apr 27, 2020
who would win if u put this build up against ur Kukri Grand Master?
The moment the Kukri Grand Master lands a critical hit he will beat the fort save of the Kukri Saint and insta-kill.
The Kukri Saint has other strengths. If he can stall the Kukri Grand Master, eg. with KD, he will wear down his HPs in a couple of rounds. The Kukri Saint is also better to detect hidden creatures and traps. Last, but not least, the Kukri Saint has a high enough UMD to cast from all scrolls without failure. That offers access to items and tactical possibilities that the Kukri Grand Master misses out on.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Yes, Evasion works with armour - it's a check against the reflex save.

For me, I like both builds, but they're slightly different in their focus. The Saint is (for what my opinion's worth) a more "playable" build, and will work well regardless of environment, with its increased versatility. Where the Grand Master shines is, as Mick says, in its Devastating Critical ability. One-hit kills are not to be sniffed at, and many would argue are the pinnacle of the strength-based meleer's craft. However, its success is more environment-dependent, with many modules and PWs having nerfed or outright banned it.

Hope Mick doesn't mind me sticking my nose in.

Cheers
